text: The 1967 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in Amsterdam, Netherlands from 22 to 27 August 1967.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Eleven events were contested, 9 for men (3 for professionals, 6 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== Piet de Wit in the men's amateur motor paced event {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | Patrick Sercu || Giuseppe Beghetto || Angelo Damiano |- | | Tiemen Groen || Hugh Porter || Leandro Faggin |- |Men's motor-paced | Leo Proost || Romain De Loof || Domenico de Lillo |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- | |Niels Fredborg || Waclaw Latocha || Roger Gibbon |- |Men's sprint | Daniel Morelon || Pierre Trentin || Luigi Borghetti |- | | Gert Bongers || Mogens Frey || Jiří Daler |- |Men's team pursuit | Stanislav Moskvin Mikhail Kolyushev Viktor Bykov Dzintars Latsis || Cipriano Chemello Antonio Castello Luigi Roncaglia Gino Pancini || Karl-Heinz Henrichs Rainer Podlesch Jürgen Kissner Karl Link |- |Men's motor-paced |Piet De Wit || Michail Markov || Dries Helsloot |- |Men's tandem | Bruno Gonzato Dino Verzini || Pierre Trentin Daniel Morelon || Daniel Goens Robert Van Lancker |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Valentina Savina |Irina Kiritchenko |Galina Ermolaeva |- |Women's individual pursuit |Tamara Garkuchina |Raisa Obodovskaya |Beryl Burton |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1967 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by the Netherlands Category:1967 in track cycling Category:August 1967 sports events Category:1960s in Amsterdam Category:Cycling in Amsterdam
title: 1967 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
